cmg.cnsim.engine.node

Interface INode

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BitcoinNode, Node

    public interface INode
    Represents a network node.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  INode.BehaviorType
      Enumeration for the behavior type of a node.

      • close

        void close(INode n)
        To be called when the node object is not closing though end of simulation or other termination condition.
        Parameters:
        n - The INode implementing object to close.

        time - The timestamp of the event.

        Returns the average connectedness of the node; i.e., the average throughput with the other nodes.
        Returns:
        The average connectedness of the node.

      • getBehavior

        INode.BehaviorType getBehavior()
        Returns the behavior type of the node.
        Returns:
        The behavior type of the node.

      • getCostPerGH

        double getCostPerGH()
        Returns the cost in conventional currency tokens in tokens/GH. Calculation is as follows: [ [electrictiyCost ($/kWh) * electricPower (W) / 1000 (W/kW)] / [3600 (s/h) * hashPower (GH/s)]] = [ [electrictiyCost ($/kWh) * electricPowerinkW (kW)] / [3600 (s/h) * hashPower (GH/s)]] = [ [electrictiyCostPerHour ($/h)] / [hashesPerHour (GH/h)]] = Tokens per billions of hashes ($/GH)
        Returns:
        Cost in conventional currency tokens in tokens/GH.

      • getElectricityCost

        float getElectricityCost()
        Get the cost (in conventional currency "tokens") of electricity in tokens/kWh (Kilowatt Hours)
        Returns:
        The cost of electricity in tokens/kWh.

      • getElectricPower

        float getElectricPower()
        Get the electric power of the node in Watts.
        Returns:
        The electric power of the node in Watts.

      • getHashPower

        float getHashPower()
        Returns the total hashpower of the node in Gigahashes (billions of hashes) per second.
        Returns:
        The hash power in GH/second.

      • getID

        int getID()
        Returns the ID of the node.

      • getTotalCycles

        double getTotalCycles()
        Returns the total PoW cycles the node has expended TODO: Unit of measure?
        Returns:
        The total PoW cycles of the node has expended.

      • periodicReport

        void periodicReport()
        Generates a time advancement report. The method is called from the simulator (or other) environment in for periodic logging on events status etc. The content and format of the report may vary depending on the implementation. This method does not take any parameters.

      • setBehavior

        void setBehavior(INode.BehaviorType h)
        Sets a behavior type of the node (HONEST, MALICIOUS etc.)
        Parameters:
        h - The behavior type.

      • setElectricityCost

        void setElectricityCost(float electricityCost)
        Sets the cost (in real world currency) of electricity in tokens/kWh (Kilowatt Hours)
        Parameters:
        electricityCost - The cost of electricity in tokens/kWh.

      • setElectricPower

        void setElectricPower(float power)
        Get the electric power of the node in Watts.
        Parameters:
        power - The electric power of the node in Watts.

      • setHashPower

        void setHashPower(float hashpower)
        TODO: Conflicts with Sampler. Check to see what the hashpower is. Set the total hash power of the node in Gigahashes (billions of hashes) per second.
        Parameters:
        hashpower - The hash power in GH/second.

      • setSimulation

        void setSimulation(Simulation sim)
        Sets the Simulation object for the node.
        Parameters:
        sim - The Simulation object.

      • timeAdvancementReport

        void timeAdvancementReport()
        Generates a time advancement report. The method is called from the simulator (or other) environment in for continues logging of events. The method is called every time a new even is processed. The content and format of the report may vary depending on the implementation. No parameters are required for this method.
